meanings.sent1: She was skiddooing from the party when it started raining heavily.
meanings.sent2: He skiddooed out of the room as soon as the teacher turned around.
meanings.sent3: The cat was skiddooing away from the vacuum cleaner like it was a monster.
meanings.sent4: The magician skiddooed off the stage in a puff of smoke.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel skiddooed up the tree to escape the barking dog.

meanings.sent1: After finishing his work, he was skiddooing home to relax.
meanings.sent2: The train skiddooed from the station right on time.
meanings.sent3: The kids were skiddooing from the playground when the ice cream truck arrived.
meanings.sent4: Her worries skiddooed from her mind as she listened to the calming music.
meanings.sent5: The sun skiddooed behind the clouds, signaling the end of the day.

meanings.sent1: The coin skiddooed from his hand and rolled under the couch.
meanings.sent2: The ghostly figure skiddooed into the mist, leaving the travelers in awe.
meanings.sent3: The last slice of cake skiddooed from the plate before she could grab it.
meanings.sent4: The memories of that day skiddooed from his mind, leaving only a faint impression.
meanings.sent5: The shooting star skiddooed across the night sky, mesmerizing everyone who saw it.
